meanings.definition: A territorial district under the jurisdiction of a church.
meanings.sent1: The parishes in our town each have their own church building.
meanings.sent2: The priest visited all the parishes in the area to offer support.
meanings.sent3: The parishes decided to have a friendly competition to see who could raise the most donations.
meanings.sent4: The parishes stood like guardians, protecting their communities with faith.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flags outside the parishes fluttered in the wind, welcoming all.

meanings.definition: The members of a particular church.
meanings.sent1: Many parishes gathered for the special service on Sunday.
meanings.sent2: The parishes worked together to organize a charity event.
meanings.sent3: The parishes held a bake-off to see who could make the best cookies.
meanings.sent4: The parishes were like a big family, always supporting each other.
meanings.sent5: The laughter and joy of the parishes filled the church hall during the celebration.

meanings.sent1: The parishes came together to clean up the neighborhood park.
meanings.sent2: The parishes were excited to welcome new families to the community.
meanings.sent3: The parishes organized a picnic for all the neighbors to enjoy.
meanings.sent4: The parishes' unity made the neighborhood a warm and welcoming place.
meanings.sent5: The parishes' voices echoed through the streets during the annual parade.
